The vitamin B1 (tiamine) is present in the germ of wheat, beans, nuts, seeds and brown rice. It is important for the patients because it protects them from bariatric beriberi, which is a postoperative complication that can lead the patient to severe cardiological and neurological complications, edema and nutritional amblyopia. Its supplementation in severe situations can reach up to 100 mg/day
